Description: Fragment of neck and rim of Attic, probably red-figured, pottery column-krater. Pendant interlinked bud frieze on neck, with added dots; top of neck part-glazed, part-reserved, indicating area of handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Dated to ca. 470 B.C. by Venit because of the relatively tight disposition of the ornament.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 98 no. 335 pl. 72)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0982)
